titlestmt.titleproper: Audiovisual Collection Relating to Georgia O'Keeffe and the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum
Audiovisual Collection Relating to Georgia O'Keeffe and the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum, 1938-2015, undated MS.44
titlestmt.author: Elizabeth Ehrnst

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-12-25 12:58:22 -0700.

did.unittitle: Audiovisual Collection Relating to Georgia O'Keeffe and the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum
did.abstract: Contains recordings of productions and events that are either related to Georgia O'Keeffe and her contemporaries or the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum dating from 1938 to 2015. Types of productions and events include broadcasts, home recordings, interviews, lectures, and symposia on audio cassettes, microcassettes, VHS tapes, and DVDs.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Use of archival audiovisual recordings requires advance notice to ensure playback equipment is available.

altformavail.head: Existence and Location of Copies
altformavail.p: Some of the video and sound recordings in this collection have been copied for research access and digital copies are available onsite.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Audiovisual Collection Relating to Georgia O'Keeffe and the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum, 1938-2015, undated. Georgia O'Keeffe Museum.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was processed in 2016 by Robert Lowe and Elizabeth Ehrnst.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is divided into two series, video recordings and sound recordings. Within the two series the materials are arranged by type of recording and then chronologically.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This is an artificial collection created by the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum. The materials were collected from a variety of sources from 1997 to 2015.

accessrestrict.legalstatus: This collection is the physical property of the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum. The Museum holds literary rights only for material created by Museum personnel or given to the Museum with such rights specifically assigned. The collection is subject to all copyright laws. The researcher assumes full responsibility for observing all copyright, property, and libel laws as they apply. Contact the Archivist for further copyright and publication information as it pertains to this collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains recordings of productions and events that are either related to Georgia O'Keeffe and her contemporaries or the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum. Types of productions and events include broadcasts, home recordings, interviews, lectures, and symposia.
Types of recording media found in the collection include: audio cassettes, microcassettes, VHS tapes, and DVDs. Some materials have been digitized and reformatted over time.
This artificial collection contains materials that were collected by the Georgia O'Keeffe Museum over a period of time and from a variety of sources.

did.unittitle: Video Recordings
Broadcasts
CBS Sunday Morning: Georgia O'Keeffe
did.abstract: Compilation of two broadcasts. Bruce Morton hosts 1981 segment, Charles Kuralt hosts 1987 segment. Includes interviews with O'Keeffe and Juan Hamilton.

did.unittitle: CBS Sunday Morning: Georgia O'Keeffe
did.abstract: Black and white version of Charles Kuralt presenting Bruce Morton segment from 5 years ago (1981). See related DVDV for final broadcast version. This is only an introduction by Kuralt.

did.unittitle: CBS Sunday Morning: Interview with Juan Hamilton about Georgia O'Keeffe
did.abstract: Black and white, unnarrated version of November 1, 1987 broadcast. Charles Kuralt interviews Juan Hamilton. See DVD for final broadcast version.

did.unittitle: ABC Good Morning America: Interview with Juan Hamilton at Abiquiu
BBC The Late Show: Georgia O'Keeffe
did.abstract: Matthew Collings host and narrator: Maria Chabot, Roxana Robinson, Anna Chave, Sarah Greenough, O'Keeffe clips throughout, Louise Bourgeois, Sarah Whitaker Peters, Barbara Lynes, Katherine Krueger, Juan Hamilton.

did.unittitle: KOB TV Cavalcade of Entertainment, Reflections on Canvas: Georgia O'Keeffe
did.abstract: Carla Aragon host: James Moore, Director of Albuquerque Museum, David Turner, Director of Museum of Fine Arts, Ellen Bradbury, Recursos de Santa Fe.

BBC American Visions series: The Republic of Virtue, Early American Art
BBC American Visions: Robert Hughes interviews Maria Chabot
did.abstract: Robert Hughes interviews Maria Chabot for the American Vision series, episode 5 of 8, The Wave from the Atlantic. Unedited. Includes footage of Abiquiu/Ghost Ranch.

did.unittitle: BBC American Visions series: The Wave from the Atlantic

did.unittitle: KOAT TV, KRQE TV Georgia O'Keeffe Museum opening
did.abstract: Footage from KOAT: Abiquiu tour. Includes footage of O'Keeffe from WNET, ABC (Good Morning America 7/17, audio of O'Keeffe, Juan Hamilton interview), NBC (Today Show, Katie Couric), CBS Sunday Morning. Notes in case.

did.abstract: J. Parker Copley dance company performs a tribute to Georgia O'Keeffe at the Power Center for the Performing Arts, University of Michigan, Ann Arbor, Michigan.

did.unittitle: Home Recordings
Georgia O'Keeffe receiving honorary degree from College of William and Mary
did.abstract: Home movie documents parts of the 1938 honorary degree ceremony when Georgia O'Keeffe received an honorary Doctor of Fine Arts degree from College of William and Mary. No sound. Digital file available.

did.unittitle: Interviews
did.abstract: Arranged alphabetically by interviewee last name.

did.unittitle: Interview with Dan Budnik
did.abstract: Includes short video of O'Keeffe and Juan Hamilton taken by Budnik.

did.unittitle: Interview with Letitia (Tish) Evans Frank
did.abstract: Uncut version of interview with Letitia (Tish) Evans Frank (1926-2009) about her friendship with Georgia O'Keeffe. By Tom McCarthy and Katie Peters.

did.unittitle: Interview with Juan Hamilton in Abiquiu
did.abstract: Unedited. Female interviewer and, Asian production team.

did.unittitle: Interview with Richard Littlefield
did.abstract: Stories told about Martin Weber party, Venice, Peggy Guggenheim, mid-70s, Claire Falkenstein designed jewelry for and presented to O'Keeffe.

did.unittitle: Interview with Todd Webb
did.abstract: Interview with Todd and Lucille Webb about career and relationship with Stieglitz and O'Keeffe. Unedited. Notes in case. Original on beta at the Palace of the Governors, Santa Fe, NM.

Land of Enchantment: Southwest U.S.A.
did.abstract: Credits: Dir/Writ. Henwar Rodakiewicz, Photog. Boris Kaufman, Ed. Rosemarie Hickson; Mus. Manuel Rosenthal; Narr. Philip Bourneuf. Contributor: Producer, U.S. Information Service. Made by Affiliated Film Productions. Features section on Georgia O'Keeffe at Ghost Ranch.
